bug.author: kellyamanda
bug.summary: KeyError: 0 when passing dataframe to st.selectbox
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>Summary</denchmark-h>
Need a better warning for when passing a full dataframe to st.selectbox. It says Warning:0. I had assumed that since it was only one column it would be fine, so we need to note that they need to pass through the column. <denchmark-h:h1>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
Create a dataframe Pass the dataframe to st.selectbox var = st.selectbox('Select something', df)

comments.comment:
Indeed. Reproduced this with the following code: <denchmark-code>import streamlit as st import pandas as pd
df = pd.DataFrame({'num_legs': [2, 4, 8, 0], 'num_wings': [2, 0, 0, 0], 'num_specimen_seen': [10, 2, 1, 8]}, index=['falcon', 'dog', 'spider', 'fish'])
var = st.selectbox('Select something', df) </denchmark-code>

This has been fixed through <denchmark-link:https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/pull/1785>#1785</denchmark-link> to address <denchmark-link:https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/issues/78>#78</denchmark-link> The solution ends up being to select the first column of a dataframe.
